data.name: Pacific Gas & Electric Company PG&E
data.description: Pacific Gas & Electric Company PG&E provides natural gas and electricity to most of the northern two-thirds of California, including San Jose. They are committed to delivering safe and reliable energy services to their customers.
data.emergency_steps:
- Alert everyone in the household and move to a safe location away from the immediate area of the gas leak.
- Avoid using matches, flashlights, and other possible ignition sources near the suspected leak.
- Do not use any electrical devices, including cell phones, until you are a safe distance away from the leak.
- Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance as soon as you are in a safe location.
- After contacting emergency services, call PG&E at 1-800-743-5000 to report the gas leak.

Non-Emergency Tips:  
- Secure helium-filled metallic balloons with weights to prevent them from floating into powerlines, which can cause outages and fires.  
- PG&E offers tips on how to prepare your home for summer to reduce energy use and save on bills.  
- If you need help with your bill, PG&E provides various payment and savings solutions pge.com pge.com.
